ServiceDescription ServiceDescription Class

Definition

Namespace:
System.Fabric.Description
Assembly:
System.Fabric.dll

A ServiceDescription contains all of the information necessary to create a service.

Edit

In this Article

[KnownType(typeof (StatelessServiceDescription))]
[KnownType(typeof (StatefulServiceDescription))]
public abstract class ServiceDescription<KnownType(GetType(StatelessServiceDescription))>
<KnownType(GetType(StatefulServiceDescription))>

ApplicationName ApplicationName

Edit

Gets or sets the name of the application.

public Uri ApplicationName { get; set; }Public Property ApplicationName As Uri
Value
Uri Uri

Returns Uri.

Attributes
KnownTypeAttribute KnownTypeAttribute

Remarks

Remarks:This is the unique name of an application and is used to group services together for management. The scheme must be "fabric://" and the application name must be a prefix of the service name.

A list that describes the correlation of the service with other services.

Metrics Metrics

Edit

Gets or sets the ServiceLoadMetricDescriptionCollection for this service. The LoadMetricDescriptionCollection contains the ServiceLoadMetricDescriptions relevant to this service

PartitionSchemeDescription PartitionSchemeDescription

Edit

Describe the partition scheme to be used for the service.

Value
PartitionSchemeDescription PartitionSchemeDescription

Attributes
KnownTypeAttribute KnownTypeAttribute

PlacementConstraints PlacementConstraints

Edit

Gets or sets the placement constraints for this service. 

public string PlacementConstraints { get; set; }Public Property PlacementConstraints As String
Value
String String

The placement constraints.

Attributes
KnownTypeAttribute KnownTypeAttribute

Remarks

Placement Constraints are Boolean statements which allow services to select for particular node properties (and the values of those properties) in order to control where it is legal to place them. Node properties are key value pairs that define some additional metadata about a node, usually related to the hardware capabilities of the node. Examples of hardware characteristics that could be exposed as node properties are “HasDisk”, “MemorySize”, “StorageSize”, “NumberOfCores” etc. When deploying a service, an administrator can define the properties that the service cares about as well as simple Boolean operators which define requirements for the values of those properties. Ex: (HasDisk==true && MemorySize>=2048). During runtime, Service Fabric Load Balancing will only place services on nodes that have properties with values which match those required by the service.

PlacementPolicies PlacementPolicies

Edit

Gets the list of ServicePlacementPolicyDescriptions belonging to the ServiceDescription.
